roleset.name: manufactured defect

example.name: typical usage
example.text: IBM has no plans to recall its add-on cards, the spokeswoman said, and could probably circumvent the bugs without long product delays.

example.name: arg 1
example.text: A recall of the mushrooms blamed for the food poisoning
example.arg: of the mushrooms blamed for the food poisoning

example.name: with arg m
example.text: a voluntary recall of both its 100 milligram and 50 milligram versions of the drug
example.arg: of both its 100 milligram and 50 milligram versions of the drug

roleset.note: RECALL-V NOTES: Member of Vncls banish-10.2. (from recall.01-v)
RECALL-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Comparison to recall.01-v. VN class banish-10.2. Framed by Katie. (from recall.01-n)
Arg2 is predicted, but I doubt it will appear. (from recall.01-v)

roleset.name: remember

example.name: straight transitive
example.text: The executive recalls Mr. Corry whispering to him and others, ``Remember, this was Dave's deal.''
example.arg: Mr. Corry whispering to him and others, ``Remember, this was Dave's deal.''

example.name: fronted
example.text: Upon returning to New York, ``Exhausted, I got into a taxicab, and the woman driver said: `Americans make better fishermen,''' he recalled *trace*.
example.arg: Upon returning to New York, ``Exhausted, I got into a taxicab, and the woman driver said: `Americans make better fishermen,'''

example.name: include wh-complementizers
example.text: In an interview a few months ago, he recalled how after some training at Salomon Brothers Inc., he successfully bid for the opportunity to sell portions of 20 U.S. corporate bond issues.
example.arg: how after some training at Salomon Brothers Inc., he successfully bid for the opportunity to sell portions of 20 U.S. corporate bond issues.

example.name: with hearer
example.text: He recalled to the audience a ``strange, infelicitous'' analogy he once heard arguing ``now that we have finally recognized that American blacks have rights, we need to do the same for animals.''
example.arg: a ``strange, infelicitous'' analogy he once heard arguing ``now that we have finally recognized that American blacks have rights, we need to do the same for animals.''

example.name: args 0, 1 and 2
example.text: their recall of the event as distinct from other encounters they could remember
example.arg: as distinct from other encounters they could remember

roleset.note: RECALL-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on nouns-00080, recall-v.02. No VNcls. (from recall.02-n)

roleset.name: ask or order to go/come back

example.name: recall-v
example.text: [H. E. Kendall]-1 was recalled *-1 for duty to England on August 28, 1918,

roleset.note: RECALL-V NOTES: Added by Julia for Google.
